Key Match Events: The Lakers essentially lost the game after the first quarter, when Cleveland nearly doubled their score 42-23.
Cleveland power forward Evan Mobley recorded 25 points and five total rebounds while shooting guard Donovan Mitchell recorded 24 points, seven assists, three total rebounds, and three steals.
Center Jarett Allen gave the performance of the game, recording 20 points, 17 total rebounds, two blocks and one assist.
Post-Match Reflections: This is the first game where we regressed and we were god awful offensively,
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers are set to face the Toronto on Saturday and then the Detroit Pistons on Monday.
Currently, the 3-2 Lakers are sitting at fifth place in the Western Conference, between the Dallas Mavericks at fourth and the Los Angeles Clippers at sixth.
Others: The loss means that LeBron James' record against his first team is now 7-3 with the records. Overall, James has beaten Cleveland 19 times and lost four times.
